cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the properties of loss surfaces in deep learning, which is a topic that falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The use of the Hessian matrix to analyze these surfaces suggests a focus on optimization techniques, which is also relevant to neural networks (cs.NE). Additionally, the paper mentions the application of these findings to computer vision (cs.CV) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), indicating a broad scope of interest. Finally, the discussion of the spectrum of the covariance matrix of gradients suggests a connection to information theory (cs.IT).
